head.title: April 23, 2020: School Closure Update - Ellenville Central School District

meta.content:
Today, Thursday, April 23, we were notified that we have an essential staff member who has tested positive for novel coronavirus (COVID-19), and two other essential staff members who are undergoing testing.
Out of an abundance of caution, the buildings, which have only been open for essential services, will now be completely closed for the next two weeks to allow time to thoroughly clean and sanitize. Staff will continue to work remotely and will be checking emails regularly. Distance learning will continue and all food deliveries will resume as scheduled.
If you have any questions, please contact your main office.
In closing, please continue to be safe. Each individual plays an important role in preventing the spread of this illness.

nav.div: Ellenville Central School District » News » What's New » April 23, 2020: School Closure Update

img.p: Today, Thursday, April 23, we were notified that we have an essential staff member who has tested positive for novel coronavirus (COVID-19), and two other essential staff members who are undergoing testing.

Out of an abundance of caution, the buildings, which have only been open for essential services, will now be completely closed for the next two weeks to allow time to thoroughly clean and sanitize. Staff will continue to work remotely and will be checking emails regularly. Distance learning will continue and all food deliveries will resume as scheduled.
If you have any questions, please contact your main office.
In closing, please continue to be safe. Each individual plays an important role in preventing the spread of this illness.
